summary: Layered audio architecture that combines dialogue, ambience, SFX, and music to create immersive, retention-driving soundscapes.

core_principles.description: Effective sound design requires dialogue, ambience, SFX, and music working in concert
Crisp, EQ'd dialogue is primary information carrier and must cut through mix
Room tone and environmental sounds prevent audio from feeling empty during pauses
Timed sound effects provide tactile feedback and make video feel responsive
Background scores dictate energy and emotional state of the content

techniques.name: Dialogue Layer Processing
techniques.description: Processing spoken audio to maintain clarity as primary information carrier
implementation: Record with quality microphone in treated space
Apply compression to control dynamics (2:1 to 4:1 ratio)
Use EQ to enhance intelligibility (boost 2-5kHz)
Reduce low-mud and high-hiss frequencies
Apply de-esser to tame sibilance
Use noise reduction if needed (gentle application)
Ensure dialogue peaks around -6dB in mix
Apply subtle saturation for warmth if desired
examples: Host讲话: compressed, EQ boosted at 3kHz
Voiceover: de-essed, noise reduced, sat at -6dB
Interview: separate processing for each person

pros_cons.pro: Clarity essential for communication and retention

techniques.name: Ambience Layer Integration
techniques.description: Environmental sounds that ground content in physical space and fill audio gaps
implementation: Capture room tone during recording (30 seconds of silence)
Add nature sounds for outdoor scenes (wind, birds, water)
Include city ambience for urban settings (traffic, distant voices)
Apply subtle ambience under talking head shots
Layer multiple ambience elements for depth
Keep levels low (−30dB to −40dB, not obtrusive)
Crossfade ambiences with scene changes
Remove ambience during visual transitions for cleaner cuts
examples: Studio shot: subtle AC hum, distant city noise
tools: Fades and automation for smooth blending

pros_cons.pro: Prevents audio from feeling empty or artificial
pros_cons.con: Can compete with dialogue if too loud

pros_cons.pro: Creates sense of place and immersion

techniques.name: Foley and SFX Layer
techniques.description: Specific sound effects synchronized with visual actions to provide tactile feedback
implementation: Whoosh on transitions and camera movements
Pop on text or image appearances
Click on mouse movements and UI interactions
Impact sounds on emphasis moments
Synchronize SFX timing to frame accuracy
Match visual impact with audio impact
Use SFX sparsely but strategically for punctuation
Layer multiple SFX elements for complex actions
examples: Text pop: sound on word appearance
tools: After Effects markers tied to audio

pros_cons.pro: Gives professional polish and attention to detail

techniques.name: Music Layer Integration
techniques.description: Background music that controls energy and emotional tone throughout video
implementation: Select music matching content energy and mood
Keep music levels below dialogue (−15dB to −20dB average)
Use music to signal energy shifts and transitions
Match music peaks to content highlights
Fade in/out for smooth transitions
Consider stem editing for detailed control
Adjust music density by content type (complex sections may need less)
Use music drops/pauses for emphasis
examples: High energy section: upbeat music at −15dB
Transition: music swell on chapter change
Emphasis: music drop on key statement

pros_cons.con: Can overwhelm dialogue if poorly balanced
Music selection critical to brand alignment

techniques.name: Silence as a Layer
techniques.description: Strategic use of silence as a powerful auditory pattern interrupt and emphasis tool
implementation: Complete music cut on key revelations jokes
Hold silence for 1-3 seconds for emphasis
Use silence after high-energy section for contrast
Signal vulnerability or seriousness with silence
Remove ambience briefly for cleaner audio focus
Return to full mix after silence resolves
Use silence sparsely for impact (not throughout video)
examples: Key statement: All audio except voice cut → silence → music returns
Punchline: music drops → joke → silence → music back
Serious moment: music fades out → spoken words → music returns

pros_cons.pro: Powerful emphasis tool, contrasts with sound

pros_cons.con: May feel abrupt if not executed well
